ygData.subject: Re: Two instances
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you, now it will be controlling jobs much simpler. But now is heritrix still pausing (for one day) 24 from 99 threads. Resuming and checkpointing from UI

Thank you, now it will be controlling jobs much simpler.

But now is heritr=
ix still pausing (for one day) 24 from 99 threads.
Resuming and checkpointi=
ng from UI or jmxclient is not working.

I can not find method in jmxclient=
 to remove or kill the threads.

Is it possible to rescue my job? (900 GB i=
s a lot ;)

Thank you.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Michael Sta=
ck <stack@...> wrote:
>
> What version of Heritrix?  If 1.8.0, the below NP=
E looks like it could 
> be related to this issue: 
>
http://sourceforge.ne=
t/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetail&aid=3D1489155&group_id=3D73833&atid=3D539=
099.
 
> If so, you'll need to update to HEAD to be able to run multiple
in=
stances.
> 
> Otherwise, are you on windows?  And is your UI still hosed?
>=
 
> Using cmdline_jmxclient, first you need to find the CrawlJob MBean in 
=
> your list of MBeans.  It looks like there is only one currently running 
=
> and its name is:
> 
>
org.archive.crawler:host=3Dhar,jmxport=3D8849,mothe=
r=3DHeritrix,name=3DCZ2006-decide-20060808104342375,type=3DCrawlService.Job=

> 
> To get listing of all the available operations and attributes for
you=
r a 
> CrawlJob, pass this cmdline-jmxclient without argument.  E.g:
> 
> %=
 java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-X.X.jar controlRole:secret localhost:8081 
>
o=
rg.archive.crawler:host=3Dhar,jmxport=3D8849,mother=3DHeritrix,name=3DCZ200=
6-decide-20060808104342375,type=3DCrawlService.Job
> 
> There'll be a lot o=
f output listing attributes and operations with 
> description of parameter=
s to pass.   Look for the checkpoint 
> operation.   It looks like the oper=
ation name is 'startCheckpoint'.  
> Notice how it doesn't take parameters.=
  Therefore, the below should run 
> the checkpoint for you:
> 
> % java -j=
ar cmdline-jmxclient-X.X.jar controlRole:secret localhost:8081 
>
org.archi=
ve.crawler:host=3Dhar,jmxport=3D8849,mother=3DHeritrix,name=3DCZ2006-decide=
-20060808104342375,type=3DCrawlService.Job

> startCheckpoint
> 
> (I haven=
't verified.  Above is just from reading the API).
> 
> Checkpoint marks th=
e progress log so check there for completion (unless 
> there it errors out=
 checkpointing).
> 
> There's a few more examples on usage here 
> http://c=
rawler.archive.org/cmdline-jmxclient/ or if you pass '-h', you 
> should ge=
t usage info.
> 
> You might try using $JAVA_HOME/bin/jconsole if you can't=
 figure the 
> cmdline_jmxclient.  Its a SWING app. that might be easier to=
 navigate.
> 
> Good luck,
> St.Ack
> 
> 
>
